image.altText: Dezi Freeman pictured outside a court in Wangaratta.

props.synopsis: A criminology researcher says rewards do work as a way of catching people, even if the success rate appears low.

title.children: Former police say rewards can work as $1m offered in Dezi Freeman search

image.altText: Two plain clothes police officers carrying paper bags.

props.synopsis: Investigators say they've broken up a major drug syndicate operating out of Melbourne's west and north-west, seizing $20 million worth of illegal drugs.

title.children: Police seize 38kg of cocaine in Melbourne drug bust

image.altText: Luke Briggs smiles and holds his dog.

props.synopsis: Two police officers are facing a negligent manslaughter charge following the death of a man several days after his arrest.

title.children: Two Victoria Police officers charged with negligent manslaughter

image.altText: A beautifully refurbished church which is now a school's performing arts centre

props.synopsis: St Michael's Grammar School in St Kilda has apologised after a cast list for an upcoming musical was uploaded to an internal website with physical descriptions such as "bogan" and "tall goof" next to students' names.

title.children: Melbourne school apologises for 'unacceptable' student descriptions

image.altText: An image of Michael Pell.

props.synopsis: Former AFL umpire Michael Pell leaked information about confidential Brownlow Medal votes and used another man’s account to place bets on the marquee event, police allege.

title.children: AFL umpire faces court over alleged Brownlow betting scam

image.altText: A man in handcuffs led by police officers.

props.synopsis: Police say 49-year-old Abdul El Houli was behind the importation of millions of dollars worth of illegal tobacco, supplying dozens of tobacco stores.

title.children: Police arrest alleged major player in Victoria's illegal tobacco trade

image.altText: A woman in a high vis vest sprays fluorescent pink on a wombat by the road

props.synopsis: Wildlife Victoria and Hume City Council are among those calling for mandatory wildlife crash reporting in Victoria, after two women die trying to help an injured animal.

title.children: New calls for wildlife crash report laws after women die helping kangaroo

image.altText: About 10 men photographed holding signs protesting their work conditions

props.synopsis: Melbourne-based company Ansell has confirmed it investigated allegations at a Malaysian factory and identified issues that do not meet labour standards.

title.children: Australian glove-maker Ansell accused of exploiting workers

image.altText: Man in a suit seated at a conference

props.synopsis: Stuart Smith has apologised for the comments he made on a WhatsApp group, and says his resignation is in the "best interests of the party".

title.children: Victorian Liberal state secretary resigns over texts mocking women

image.altText: A composite image of two boys who were victims of a fatal knife attack

props.synopsis: Community leaders call for justice for 15-year-old Dau Akueng and 12-year-old Chol Achiek, who have been murdered in what investigators say may have been a case of mistaken identity.

title.children: Mourners honour beloved boys killed in violent Melbourne attack

image.altText: A white electric ute in a green paddock with a trailer full of tree waste

props.synopsis: The Ford F150 Lightning is being touted as the first viable EV for farm work, but it comes with a hefty price tag.

title.children: Is this the first electric ute that farmers will want to use?

image.altText: Detective Superintendent Jason Kelly provides an update to media.

props.synopsis: Officers say the announcement of the reward over the weekend triggered a significant amount of information, but there are still no confirmed sightings of the alleged gunman.

title.children: Police combing through 200 tips after posting $1m Dezi Freeman reward

image.altText: A closeup of a ready-to-be-harvested medicinal cannabis plant.

props.synopsis: Despite more than 600 reports of "adverse events" for medicinal cannabis in the past three years, the Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA) is yet to investigate the safety of most medicinal cannabis products. It has now launched a review.

title.children: Psychiatrists fear medicinal cannabis adverse events are 'tip of the iceberg'

image.altText: A group of men wearing black.

props.synopsis: Victoria Police admitted they failed to stop an attack on Camp Sovereignty last month because they did not know it was happening. More officers will be deployed in Melbourne this weekend for planned protests.

title.children: Police admit they were caught off guard by Camp Sovereignty attack

image.altText: The high-rise towers in Melbourne CBD in the distance, with green trees and houses in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The government has released the first batch of maps revealing what a high-density future could look like for Melbourne residents.

title.children: High-rise plans could transform these Melbourne suburbs

image.altText: Bailey Smith points during a confrontation with a photographer at Geelong Cats AFL training.

props.synopsis: A veteran Geelong Advertiser photographer says she has never had a player confront her for taking a photograph at training, aside from two incidents involving Cats superstar Bailey Smith.

title.children: Veteran photographer 'rattled' after expletive-laden abuse from Cats star

image.altText: Navya Nair smiles and flashes the peace sign as she sits in a business class seat on a plane.

props.synopsis: The incident involving Navya Nair highlights a common concern facing many visitors to Australia — what can be brought in without the risk of breaching strict biosecurity laws?

title.children: Visiting Indian actor fined for not declaring flowers from her dad

image.altText: A tiny lamb the size of a farmer's boot, wearing a pastel tartan woollen coat in paddock with normal lambs towering over him.

props.synopsis: The tiny lamb that captured the hearts of Australians during COVID has died, leaving a heartbroken family behind.

title.children: Tiny lamb that became internet sensation during COVID dies

image.altText: An employee examining ammunition at a factory

props.synopsis: Less than a year after its announcement, the Department of Defence quietly scraps a procurement promising to scale up production at Thales Australia's north-east Victorian facility.

title.children: Defence quietly axes ammunition procurement with Thales Australia

image.altText: Erin Patterson being led into a prison van

props.synopsis: Over the course of 46 minutes, Justice Christopher Beale outlined the case that has gripped Australia — and the world — for more than two years.

title.children: 'Failure to exhibit any remorse': What the judge revealed in Erin Patterson sentencing

image.altText: Sam Groth and his wife Brittany, who is smiling, at an election party

props.synopsis: The Herald Sun defamed Victorian Deputy Opposition Leader Sam Groth by implying he sexually assaulted his wife when she was a teenager, according to court documents.

title.children: Herald Sun defamed Sam Groth and invaded wife's privacy, MP claims

image.altText: Two people wearing possum skins pass a traditional object between each other.

props.synopsis: Victoria's historic treaty is promising to "reckon with the past" and empower the state's First Peoples — and explicitly declares it will not take anything away from the broader community.

title.children: Australia-first treaty with First Peoples tabled in Victorian parliament

image.altText: A person with the hands hovering beneath a steering wheel in a car that's driving itself through automation.

props.synopsis: An apparent test drive of Tesla's automated self-driving technology in Melbourne's CBD earlier this year was not approved by the Victorian government.

title.children: Tesla is pushing a 'fully autonomous future' but this test broke the rules

image.altText: A young man with a medal and cup stands in a clubroom with banners and balloons.

props.synopsis: League administrators have blocked a talented young footballer's return to a regional Victorian finals series after a brain cancer diagnosis because he did not play enough games.

title.children: League denies footballer finals fairytale amid brain cancer battle

image.altText: Several young women wearing gumboots run on a football oval.

props.synopsis: The most crucial rule of South Gippsland's annual Gumboot Gift running race is "authentic" gumboots only, with no fancy slimline or ankle-height boots allowed.

title.children: Gumboots replace running shoes for this annual community race

image.altText: Woman dressed in black dress push a stroller with young child inside, black guide dog is beside woman.

props.synopsis: University of Sydney research shows 60 per cent of those living with a disability don't have any sort of emergency plan.

title.children: Study finds people with disability lack support during emergencies

image.altText: A close up of five bouquets and a small painting that says rest in peace at the base of a tree

props.synopsis: Jacinta Allan offered her condolences to the families of two boys who were fatally stabbed at Cobblebank over the weekend as police continue to search for those responsible.

title.children: Premier considers more police powers after fatal Melbourne stabbings

image.altText: A police coffin at a funeral with cap and flowers on top of it

props.synopsis: Lisa Thompson says her final weekend with her boyfriend Neal Thompson before he was killed in a shooting at Porepunkah was their best yet.

title.children: Police officer Neal Thompson farewelled by grieving loved ones

image.altText: Nurses and supporting trade unionists rally outside Parliament House in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: For the first time in 36 years Victorian nurses' union members will vote on a new branch secretary after a failed pay deal led to the resignation of the former boss.

title.children: Turmoil in powerful nurses union as members vote on Victorian branch boss

image.altText: A young woman with long dark hair smiles big looking up. Behind is a collage of images including her as a child and a pink robe

props.synopsis: When Louisa Ioannidis was found dead in a creek, police found no suspicious circumstances. But Louisa’s brother had his doubts, and now a legal team has found compelling new evidence that the case should be reopened.

title.children: 'Hallmarks of something suspicious': How could a 24yo drown in knee-high water?

image.altText: Anti-immigration rally Canberra

props.synopsis: Australia's Neo-Nazis sought to make their own message out of anti-immigration marches, and they succeeded.

title.children: Australia's Neo-Nazis have had an unadulterated propaganda win

image.altText: A red and black graphic of a crowd in silhouette under a white supremacist flag and the Australian flag.

props.synopsis: As the National Socialist Network follows the script of a far-right playbook in an attempt to position itself as a political movement, there are moves to have it proscribed as a terrorist group.

title.children: Leaked messages reveal how Neo-Nazis piggyback on groups abroad

image.altText: Sheep having a feed. Drone photo taken from above.

props.synopsis: The nation's drought supports will come under scrutiny at a major national forum today as southern farmers continue to battle dry times.

title.children: Farmers call for low-interest loans as cash flow dries up in drought

image.altText: GettyImages-2233113636

props.synopsis: Dockers coach Justin Longmuir says the AFL should issue fines of up to $10,000 to players for staging.

title.children: Coach calls for huge fines to stamp out AFL players staging for free kicks

image.altText: GettyImages-2234088784

props.synopsis: Chloe Molloy kicks a stunner and Zippy Fish stars as the Swans account for the Dockers in the AFLW.

title.children: Molloy wonder goal stuns the crowd as Fish stars for Swans
